alert.note: Alert for Bell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 7:46PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Bell County through 815 PM EDT... At 745 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Meldrum, or near Middlesboro, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Middlesboro, Noetown, Davisburg and Binghamtown around 750 PM EDT. THIS INCLUDES U.S. Highway 25 East in Bell County between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
